oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Nashville YMCA historic marker, Nashville, Tennessee, 1977 July
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An historic marker for the Nashville Y.M.C.A. that reads: “On this site in the Christian Church the Nashville Young Men’s Christian Association was organized May 18, 1875. Its first building, erected 1886 on Church between Cherry and College, was destroyed by fire in 1894. In 1912 it moved into its new eight-story building on Seventh & Union which it occupied until 1972 when it moved to its present building, 1000 Church St.” Forms part of the Claynita Harris Slide Collection. The original is a 35 mm color transparency (2 x 2 in. slide mount)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: YMCA of Middle Tennessee--History--Sources
